title: Two Dalmatics

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of velvet: silk, plain weave variation with silk supplementary facing wefts, weft-float faced 1:2 'z' twill interlacings of secondary binding warps and gilt-metal-strip-wrapped silk, supplementary facing wefts forming weft loops, and supplementary pile warps forming cut and uncut, pile-on-pile, voided velvet; cuffs and apparels: silk, warp-float faced 3:1 broken warp chevron twill weave with supplementary pile warps forming cut solid velvet; appliquéd with linen, plain weave; embroidered with silk, linen and gilt-metal-strip-wrapped silk in couching and padded couching; edge trim: 1) silk, warp-float faced 7:1 satin weave; embroidered with silk and gilt-metal -strip-wrapped silk in couching, and 2) silk and gilt-metal-strip-wrapped silk, plain weave (with multiple wefts) with supplementary patterning wefts and extended ground weft cut and uncut fringe.

date_display: Late 15th/early 16th century (cuffs and apparels: late 15th century
artist_display: Italy or Spain (cuffs and apparels: Spain)
medium_display: Velvet: silk, plain weave variation with silk supplementary facing wefts, weft-float faced 1:2 'Z' twill interlacings of secondary binding warps and gilt-metal-strip-wrapped silk, supplementary facing wefts forming weft loops, and supplementary pile warps forming cut and uncut, pile-on-pile, voided velvet; Cuffs and Apparels: silk, warp-float faced 3:1 broken warp chevron twill weave with supplementary pile warps forming cut solid velvet; appliquéd with linen, plain weave; embroidered with silk, linen and gilt-metal-strip-wrapped silk in couching and padded couching; Edge trim: 1) silk, warp-float faced 7:1 satin weave; embroidered with silk and gilt-metal -strip-wrapped silk in couching, and 2) silk and gilt-metal-strip-wrapped silk, plain weave (with multiple wefts) with supplementary patterning wefts and extended ground weft cut and uncut fringe
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Chauncey McCormick and Mrs. Richard Ely Danielson
exhibition_history:
Art Institute of Chicago, Gunsaulus Hall, Department of European Decorative Arts, April 10-Sept. 26, 1989. 

Art Institute of Chicago, Gunsaulus Hall, Department of European Decorative Arts, Dec. 21, 1990-July 17, 1991.

Art Institute of Chicago, Gunsaulus Hall, Department of European Decorative Arts, Dec. 5, 1995-Jan. 18, 1996.

Art Institute of Chicago, Elizabeth F. Cheney and Agnes Allerton Textile Galleries, Gloria in Excelsis Deo - Heralding a Vestment Collection, Sept. 11, 1996–Jan. 12, 1997.

Art Institute of Chicago, Gunsaulus Hall, Department of European Decorative Arts, Feb. 15-Aug. 2, 2001

Art Institute of Chicago, Elizabeth F. Cheney and Agnes Allerton Textile Galleries, Renaissance Velvets and Silks, Dec. 18, 2002–Apr. 13, 2003.
provenance_text: Charles Deering, Chicago and Miami, FL (died 1927) [acquisition documentation in curatorial object file]; by descent to his daughters, Marian Deering McCormick, Chicago (died 1965, also Mrs. Chauncey McCormick), and Barbara Deering Danielson, Groton, MA (died 1982, also Mrs. Ely Danielson) [Incoming permanent receipt R9337, July 27, 1948; copy in curatorial object file]; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1948.
